analyzed: ma dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rgyud dang sngags bslabs par gyur na de'i tshe sngags la sogs pa nye du yin par mi spyad cing sbyin par bya zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It is said, mother, and so forth. The meaning is that when one has been trained in the tantra and mantra, at that time one should not treat the mantra and so forth as a relative, and one should give.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa la sngags byin pa de ni rung ba yin te gzhan du ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa la sngags byin pa de ni rung ba yin te gzhan du ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It is said, whoever, and so forth. The meaning is that the mantra that is given is suitable, not another.

original: dam tshig rtag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnal 'byor pas gang gi tshe spyad par bya ba de ston pa'o //
analyzed: dam tshig rtag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnal 'byor pas gang gi tshe spyad par bya ba de ston pa'o //
translated: The verse beginning Always the pledge teaches what the yogin should practice.

original: skyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la skyes pa'am bud med rnal 'byor mas mthong na g-yon gyi cha ru byas nas 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: skyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la skyes pa'am bud med rnal 'byor mas mthong na g-yon gyi cha ru byas nas 'gro ba'o //
translated: The verse beginning male and so on teaches that when a yogin or yoginī sees a male or female, they should go to the left.

original: ring yang shes 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ring yang khyim ma ma zhing du g-yon pa'i spyod pas bya zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ring yang shes 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ring yang khyim ma ma zhing du g-yon pa'i spyod pas bya zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The verse beginning Even if far away and so on teaches that even if far away, one should go to the left in the field of the house.

original: he ru ka las sbyar gzhan med //
analyzed: he ru ka las sbyar gzhan med //
translated: There is no other union than that with Heruka.

original: ces pa ni dpal he ru ka'i rnal 'byor las mchog tu gyur pa'i rnal 'byor gzhan med ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: ces pa ni dpal he ru ka'i rnal 'byor las mchog tu gyur pa'i rnal 'byor gzhan med ces pa'i don to //
translated: This means that there is no other union superior to the union with Śrī Heruka.

original: 'di nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: slob dpon rnal 'byor ma nyid yin //🔽zhes bya ste /🔽de'i rnal 'byor 'chang ba'i slob dpon ni rnal 'byor ma kun gyi @190a * //
analyzed: slob dpon rnal 'byor ma nyid yin // zhes bya ste / de'i rnal 'byor 'chang ba'i slob dpon ni rnal 'byor ma kun gyi @190a * //
translated: the master is a yoginī herself.🔽This means that the master who holds her yoga is a yoginī herself.

original: ma'i gnas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma'i gnas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the abode of all yoginīs.

original: rgyud 'di ru ni sgrub pa po legs par gyur pa nyid yin no zhes pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: rgyud 'di ru ni sgrub pa po legs par gyur pa nyid yin no zhes pa ni go sla'o //
translated: In this Tantra, the adept is well-established. The meaning is easy to understand.

original: khva gdong la sogs 'di dag ni //
analyzed: khva gdong la sogs 'di dag ni //
translated: These, Kāka-mukha and so forth,

original: mos dang dad pa 'phel byed pa //
analyzed: mos dang dad pa 'phel byed pa //
translated: are the increase of devotion and faith.

original: zhes pa ni dngos grub rnams kyi rgyun ni brgyad po 'di yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dngos grub rnams kyi rgyun ni brgyad po 'di yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that these eight are the cause of powers.

original: dang po ni sngon du bstan pa'i g-yon pa la sogs pa'i dam tshig skyong pa'o //
analyzed: dang po ni sngon du bstan pa'i g-yon pa la sogs pa'i dam tshig skyong pa'o //
translated: The first is the observance of the commitments of the left and so forth as previously taught.🔽The one who is attached to desire

original: lha gzhan dag dang kun sbyor ba'i //🔽'dod la chags par gyur ba ni //
analyzed: lha gzhan dag dang kun sbyor ba'i // 'dod la chags par gyur ba ni //
translated: in union with other deities,

original: zhes pa ni 'dod pa ni rnam par rtog pas 'dod cing yid la 'dod pa ste lha gzhan la yang dag par sbyor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'dod pa ni rnam par rtog pas 'dod cing yid la 'dod pa ste lha gzhan la yang dag par sbyor bar byed pa'o //
translated: desire is the desire and mental desire of conceptualization, and it is the union with other deities.

original: chags pa ni chags zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: chags pa ni chags zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Attachment is the meaning of “attached.”

original: 'di'i phyir gzhan gyi rnal 'byor spang bar bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i phyir gzhan gyi rnal 'byor spang bar bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: For this reason, the second is the abandonment of the yoga of others.

original: rmad du byung ba'i rang dang gzhan gyi cha spang ba ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: rmad du byung ba'i rang dang gzhan gyi cha spang ba ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The third is the abandonment of the marvelous parts of oneself and others.

original: thogs pa med pa zhes pa ni gang gis kyang gzhom du mi nus pa ste bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa zhes pa ni gang gis kyang gzhom du mi nus pa ste bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth is unobstructed, which means that it cannot be overcome by anything.

original: dam tshig spyad pa spyod pa dang // zhes pa ni dam tshig ni lha mo ste de la spyod pa ni 'dod pa ste de la sems kyi bya bas gang dam tshig la spyod pa ni lnga pa'o //🔽bud med dbang phyug shin tu sbyor //
analyzed: dam tshig spyad pa spyod pa dang // zhes pa ni dam tshig ni lha mo ste de la spyod pa ni 'dod pa ste de la sems kyi bya bas gang dam tshig la spyod pa ni lnga pa'o // bud med dbang phyug shin tu sbyor //
translated: The fifth is practicing the vow, which means that the vow is the goddess, and practicing it is desire, and that is the mental activity that is practiced in the vow.

original: zhes pa ni rdo rje dang padma bsrubs pa'i dus su dbang phug dang bral ba nyid du mi bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rdo rje dang padma bsrubs pa'i dus su dbang phug dang bral ba nyid du mi bya'o //
translated: The sixth is the union of the powerful woman, which means that at the time of churning the vajra and lotus, one should not be separated from the powerful woman.

original: de ji lta bu snyam na dbang phyug nyid du bya'i zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ji lta bu snyam na dbang phyug nyid du bya'i zhes pa'i don to //
translated: If one wonders what that is like, it means one should act as the powerful one.

original: 'di ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni drug pa'o //
translated: This is the sixth.

original: tshangs par spyod pa de lta bu 'chang ba'i byang chub kyi sems len pa'i dus su tshangs pa nyid du spyad do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa de lta bu 'chang ba'i byang chub kyi sems len pa'i dus su tshangs pa nyid du spyad do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The seventh is practicing celibacy, which means that at the time of taking the bodhisattva vow, one should practice as if one were celibate.

original: 'di ni bdun pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bdun pa'o //
translated: This is the seventh.

original: khro med rgyun gyis kun du spyod //
analyzed: khro med rgyun gyis kun du spyod //
translated: The eighth is practicing with the continuous absence of anger, which means that one should practice with the absence of anger.🔽 The ninth is practicing with the continuous absence of pride, which means that one should practice with the absence of pride.

original: ces pa ni byang chub kyi sems len pa'i dus su btsog pa'i 'du shes mi bya ba ste brgyad do //
analyzed: ces pa ni byang chub kyi sems len pa'i dus su btsog pa'i 'du shes mi bya ba ste brgyad do //
translated: This is the eighth rule, not to have a sense of impurity at the time of taking the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: dam tshig gi spyod pa mchog phul du byung ba la gnas par bya ba ste /
analyzed: dam tshig gi spyod pa mchog phul du byung ba la gnas par bya ba ste /
translated: One should abide in the supreme, excellent practice of the commitments.

original: sgrub ba pa ni zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sgrub ba pa ni zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The adept, etc.

original: gzhung gzhan la yang lhag ma'i blo don ni 'di nyid do //
analyzed: gzhung gzhan la yang lhag ma'i blo don ni 'di nyid do //
translated: The meaning of the rest of the passage is just this.

original: rgyud kun gyi ni thun mong ste //
analyzed: rgyud kun gyi ni thun mong ste //
translated: It is common to all the Tantras.

original: zhes pa ni gsang ba'i 'di ni rgyud thams cad kyi thun mong du mngon par 'brel pa ste yang dag pa'i sngags kyi don du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gsang ba'i 'di ni rgyud thams cad kyi thun mong du mngon par 'brel pa ste yang dag pa'i sngags kyi don du rig par bya'o //
translated: This secret is related as common to all the Tantras, and should be known as the true meaning of the mantra.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: rgyu med par ni smad mi bya //
analyzed: rgyu med par ni smad mi bya //
translated: one should not disparage without cause.

original: zhes gsungs te rgyu ni tshad ma ste des smad par mi bya zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes gsungs te rgyu ni tshad ma ste des smad par mi bya zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Cause means a valid means of knowledge. The meaning is that one should not disparage without that.

original: yang ci bya zhes pa la /
analyzed: yang ci bya zhes pa la /
translated: What should one do?

original: dad pa nyid kyis blang bya yin //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dad pa nyid kyis blang bya yin // zhes gsungs te /
translated: It should be taken up by faith alone.

original: mig dang lag pas ma yin zhes pa 'di @190b nyid kyi don ston to //
analyzed: mig dang lag pas ma yin zhes pa 'di @190b nyid kyi don ston to //
translated: This shows the meaning of not by the eye and the hand.

original: blo ldan mthe'u chung bskyod par ni //
analyzed: blo ldan mthe'u chung bskyod par ni //
translated: The wise one should move the little finger.

original: zhes pa ni phyi rol gyi yan lag gi lha mo la mchod pa'i dus su lha'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas bya zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni phyi rol gyi yan lag gi lha mo la mchod pa'i dus su lha'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas bya zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This means that at the time of worship of the outer goddesses of limbs, one should do it endowed with the yoga of the deity.

original: yang na sngags dang rgyud legs par bslabs pa gal te ma rnyed na gzhan yang lha'i rang bzhin du byas la mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na sngags dang rgyud legs par bslabs pa gal te ma rnyed na gzhan yang lha'i rang bzhin du byas la mchod par bya'o //
translated: Or else, if one does not find a well-trained mantra and tantra, one should worship others also, making them into the nature of the deity.

original: pho nya mo rnams yang dag gnas //
analyzed: pho nya mo rnams yang dag gnas //
translated: The messengers are perfectly situated.

original: zhes pa ni de ltar de'i dus su blo dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa la pho nya thams cad rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar de'i dus su blo dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa la pho nya thams cad rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This means that at that time, all messengers are very pleased with the wise yogi.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: mnyes byed rnam par dag pa dang // gsal byed yon tan ldan pa'i mi //
analyzed: mnyes byed rnam par dag pa dang // gsal byed yon tan ldan pa'i mi //
translated: The one who pleases, the one who is pure, the one who illuminates, the one who has qualities,

original: zhes pa ni yon tan dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i mi ni rnam pa gsum du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni yon tan dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i mi ni rnam pa gsum du shes par bya ste /
translated: The one who has qualities should be known as a person of three kinds:

original: mnyes byed ces pa ni nus pa ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: mnyes byed ces pa ni nus pa ma skyes pa'o //
translated: The one who pleases is the one who has not generated ability.

original: rnam par dag pa ni nus pa skyes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa ni nus pa skyes pa'o //
translated: The pure one is the one in whom the capacity has arisen.

original: gsal byed ces pa ni dbus mar gsal ba ste //
analyzed: gsal byed ces pa ni dbus mar gsal ba ste //
translated: The one who is illuminated is the one in the middle.

original: nus pa cung zad skyes shing bstan bcos kyi don rig pa'o //
analyzed: nus pa cung zad skyes shing bstan bcos kyi don rig pa'o //
translated: The one in whom a little capacity has arisen, who knows the meaning of the treatise.

original: yang na mnyes byed ces pa ni sngags dang rnal 'byor la goms shing lha mnyes pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang na mnyes byed ces pa ni sngags dang rnal 'byor la goms shing lha mnyes pa byed pa'o //
translated: Or else, the one who pleases is the one who is familiar with the mantra and yoga, who pleases the deity.

original: yon tan dang ldan pa'i mi bstan bcos kyi don rig pa ni gsal byed de //
analyzed: yon tan dang ldan pa'i mi bstan bcos kyi don rig pa ni gsal byed de //
translated: The one who has the qualities, who knows the meaning of the treatise, is the one who is illuminated.

original: sgron ma dang 'dra bas sems can gyi don gyi bya ba nus pa'o //
analyzed: sgron ma dang 'dra bas sems can gyi don gyi bya ba nus pa'o //
translated: Like a lamp, he is able to perform the welfare of sentient beings.

original: dpal he ru ka mngon par brjod pa'i slob ma brtag pa'i sdom pa'i cho ga'i le'u nyi shu rtsa drug pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: dpal he ru ka mngon par brjod pa'i slob ma brtag pa'i sdom pa'i cho ga'i le'u nyi shu rtsa drug pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the twenty-sixth chapter of the Sri Herukabhidhana, the Procedure of the Vows of the Examination of the Disciple.

original: // / de nas zhes pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: // / de nas zhes pa ni go sla'o //
translated: Then, easy to understand.

original: rnal 'byor brtul zhugs dpa' bo yi //
analyzed: rnal 'byor brtul zhugs dpa' bo yi //
translated: The hero of yogic discipline,

original: rnal 'byor ma kun sgrub byed pa //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma kun sgrub byed pa //
translated: the one who accomplishes all yoginis,

original: mtshan nyid khyad par shes byas nas //
analyzed: mtshan nyid khyad par shes byas nas //
translated: having understood the characteristics,

original: myur du dngos grub rab 'jug byed //
analyzed: myur du dngos grub rab 'jug byed //
translated: quickly enters into the supreme attainment.

original: ces pa ni sgrub pa po spyod pa'i brtul zhugs kyi dpa' bos rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyi khyad par shes par byas nas rnal 'byor ma rnams las myur du dngos grub 'thob po zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ces pa ni sgrub pa po spyod pa'i brtul zhugs kyi dpa' bos rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyi khyad par shes par byas nas rnal 'byor ma rnams las myur du dngos grub 'thob po zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This means that the hero of the practitioner's conduct, having understood the characteristics of the yoginis, quickly attains power from the yoginis.

original: yul dang yul du de rab sang  //
analyzed: yul dang yul du de rab sang  //
translated: In every place, she is seen

original: pho nya'i gzugs su mtshon pa yin //
analyzed: pho nya'i gzugs su mtshon pa yin //
translated: in the form of a messenger.

original: zhes pa ni de ltar rnal 'byor pa rnam pa gsum gyis gzugs dang mtshan nyid phun sum tshogs pa'i pho nya yul dang yul du rnam par mthong zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar rnal 'byor pa rnam pa gsum gyis gzugs dang mtshan nyid phun sum tshogs pa'i pho nya yul dang yul du rnam par mthong zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This means that the three kinds of yogis see in every place the messenger who is perfect in form and characteristics.

original: pho nya ral gri'i so 'dra zhing //🔽zhes pa ni pho nya dang ral @191a * //
analyzed: pho nya ral gri'i so 'dra zhing // zhes pa ni pho nya dang ral @191a * //
translated: The messenger is like the edge of a sword.

original: gri'i so gnyis mthun pas mnyes par dka' zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gri'i so gnyis mthun pas mnyes par dka' zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This means that the messenger and the edge of a sword are similar, and so she is difficult to please.

original: dag byed ces bya ba la sogs pa la dag par byed cing bsod nams 'phel nas sgrub pa pos dngos grub 'thob ste /
analyzed: dag byed ces bya ba la sogs pa la dag par byed cing bsod nams 'phel nas sgrub pa pos dngos grub 'thob ste /
translated: The meaning of purifier and so on is that the practitioner attains power by purifying and increasing merit.

original: dbyer med pa thob nas mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub 'thob ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: dbyer med pa thob nas mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub 'thob ces pa'i don to //
translated: Having attained inseparability, one attains the desired power.

original: 'di nyid kyi phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa la sogs par brjod pa las grol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa la sogs par brjod pa las grol ba'o //
translated: For this very reason, one is liberated from the expression of the unreal, etc.

original: sgrub pa gnyis zhes pa ni sgrub pa pos 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub grub ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: sgrub pa gnyis zhes pa ni sgrub pa pos 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub grub ces pa'i don to //
translated: The two accomplishments are the accomplishment of the power of the adept, mundane and supramundane.

original: gnyis kyi cho ga la spyod pa //
analyzed: gnyis kyi cho ga la spyod pa //
translated: The conduct in the rite of the two

original: pho nya gcig pu kho na yin //
analyzed: pho nya gcig pu kho na yin //
translated: is that of the single hero alone.

original: zhes pa ni gcig pu nyid dpal he ru ka'i rnal 'byor lhag par ston pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gcig pu nyid dpal he ru ka'i rnal 'byor lhag par ston pa'o //
translated: This teaches the superiority of the yoga of the single hero, Śrī Heruka.

original: gzhung gzhan yang 'di'i don to //
analyzed: gzhung gzhan yang 'di'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this is also the meaning of another text.

original: yang na kha cig dngos grub la spyod bzhin pas de gcig nyid kho na'i rnal 'byor mchog ste /
analyzed: yang na kha cig dngos grub la spyod bzhin pas de gcig nyid kho na'i rnal 'byor mchog ste /
translated: Or, while enjoying power, the yoga of that single hero alone is the supreme.

original: de'i pho nya'i rnal 'byor ma des rab tu bskul ba ste /
analyzed: de'i pho nya'i rnal 'byor ma des rab tu bskul ba ste /
translated: That hero’s yoginī is the one who impels him.

original: dngos grub sgrub par rtsom zhes sbyar ro //🔽bla ma brgyud rim gyis thob pa'i //
analyzed: dngos grub sgrub par rtsom zhes sbyar ro // bla ma brgyud rim gyis thob pa'i //
translated: One should add, “to undertake the practice of power.”🔽The consecration is the mantra well-endowed

original: dbang bskur ba ni sngags legs ldan //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba ni sngags legs ldan //
translated: with the stages of the lineage of gurus.

original: pho nya rnams su yang dag bshad //
analyzed: pho nya rnams su yang dag bshad //
translated: The messengers are also explained.

original: ces pa ni bla ma brgyud pa'i rim pas srog gis dbang bskur zhing gang gi tshe legs par sbyar bar gyur pa yin pa de'i tshe rnal 'byor pa'i nges par pho nya yang dag brjod ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: ces pa ni bla ma brgyud pa'i rim pas srog gis dbang bskur zhing gang gi tshe legs par sbyar bar gyur pa yin pa de'i tshe rnal 'byor pa'i nges par pho nya yang dag brjod ces pa'i don to //
translated: This means that when the yogin is consecrated with the life-force through the stages of the lineage of gurus and is well-prepared, at that time the messengers are also explained.

original: phyag rgya legs sbyor ngang tshul dang // zhes pa ni phyi rol gyi yan lag dang yang dag par sbyor ba'i ngang tshul can zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: phyag rgya legs sbyor ngang tshul dang // zhes pa ni phyi rol gyi yan lag dang yang dag par sbyor ba'i ngang tshul can zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The nature of the well-prepared consort means the nature of being well-prepared with the external branches.

original: yang dag rdzogs zhes pa ni gal te yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag rdzogs zhes pa ni gal te yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa'o //
translated: The well-completed means if it is fully completed.

original: ye shes rgyu skyes zhes pa ni /
analyzed: ye shes rgyu skyes zhes pa ni /
translated: The wisdom-born cause means

original: ye shes phul du byung ba'i bar gyi rgyu ni byed pa ste dpal rdo rje drag po de las skyes pa yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ye shes phul du byung ba'i bar gyi rgyu ni byed pa ste dpal rdo rje drag po de las skyes pa yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: the cause of the excellent wisdom is the agent, meaning born from that glorious Vajraheruka.

original: nang par langs ni mtha' ru dam tshig las langs te /
analyzed: nang par langs ni mtha' ru dam tshig las langs te /
translated: Having arisen in the morning, one arises from the pledge at the end,🔽and🔽having gone to the forest means having gone to the place of practice.

original: sems kyi bdag nyid phyag rgya chen po'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas gzugs kyi bya ba kun byas te lus po dpa' bo drug gi go chas go bgos la /
analyzed: sems kyi bdag nyid phyag rgya chen po'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas gzugs kyi bya ba kun byas te lus po dpa' bo drug gi go chas go bgos la /
translated: Having the yoga of the great seal of the nature of mind, one should perform all the actions of form, and one should don the armor of the six heroes on the body.

original: lus la shin tu mtshon cha ni //
analyzed: lus la shin tu mtshon cha ni //
translated: The weapons are very much on the body,

original: lus la gnas par kun gyis spyad //
analyzed: lus la gnas par kun gyis spyad //
translated: and all should be practiced as abiding in the body.

original: ces pa ni lus thams cad mtshon cha'i dra bas rab tu khyab par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ces pa ni lus thams cad mtshon cha'i dra bas rab tu khyab par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This means that one should pervade the entire body with a net of weapons.

original: dag byed byas pa'i lus dang ni //
analyzed: dag byed byas pa'i lus dang ni //
translated: The body that has been purified

original: rtag tu sngags ni brjod @191b par bya //
